title: Mixed Hearing Loss with History of Cholesteatoma and Mastoidectomy
chief_complaint: I am here to monitor my hearing sensitivity. I haven't noticed any significant changes in my hearing over the past few years, but I have constant ringing in both ears.

problem_summary.onset: Long-standing history of hearing loss in the left ear.
problem_summary.course: Stable; no significant changes reported over the past few years.
problem_summary.laterality: Bilateral symptoms (tinnitus) with asymmetric hearing loss (worse in left).
problem_summary.functional_impact: Patient reports no recent significant changes in functional hearing.
problem_summary.goals_motivation: Monitoring hearing sensitivity and managing the condition.

history.present_illness: Patient returned for monitoring. Reports stable hearing but constant bilateral tinnitus.
history.otologic_history: History of chronic otitis media, cholesteatoma, and multiple surgeries in the left ear including mastoidectomy and ossiculoplasty.
history.prior_management: Last hearing test was completed 1 year ago.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Normal hearing (250-2000 Hz) sloping to mild sensorineural hearing loss (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderately severe rising to mild mixed hearing loss (250-2000 Hz), sloping to moderate/moderately severe mixed loss (3000-4000 Hz), rising to moderate at 6-8 kHz. Significant air-bone gaps present in the left ear.

numeric_results.LE_Air_Bone_Gap: Significant (Bone thresholds 0-15 dB HL vs Air thresholds 30-70 dB HL)

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.key_findings: SRT scores are in agreement with PTA. WRS indicates normal ability to recognize speech bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.key_findings: Right ear: Hypercompliant tympanic membrane with excessive negative pressure. Left ear: Flat tympanogram with large ear canal volume (consistent with mastoidectomy history).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.key_findings: Threshold and decay testing were not measured.

overall_audiologic_summary: The patient presents with asymmetric hearing. The right ear exhibits normal sensitivity sloping to a mild high-frequency sensorineural loss with negative middle ear pressure. The left ear demonstrates a complex mixed hearing loss (ranging from mild to moderately severe) with excellent speech recognition, consistent with the history of ossiculoplasty and mastoidectomy (evidenced by large canal volume).
counseling_points: Your hearing has remained stable with no significant changes compared to your previous test.
The 'flat' reading on the left ear pressure test is expected given your history of mastoid surgery and the larger volume of your ear canal.
We recommend you continue your scheduled follow-up with your otologist for medical management.
We should discuss amplification options (hearing aids) for your left ear, as well as Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT), to help balance your hearing.
Return for a hearing test after your medical management is complete or as needed.
notes_for_actor: Portray a patient who is accustomed to their hearing loss and medical history; you are not distressed but are diligent about monitoring.
You have constant ringing (tinnitus) in both ears, but you report it calmly as a chronic symptom.
You have had many surgeries on your left ear, so you are knowledgeable about your 'bad ear'.
